body.contents: An inventory detector is an enchanted banner attached to a block with an inventory. It shows a dynamically constructed title when a shulker box is detected in its inventory.
The detector reads all of the items in the shulker box and constructs the title from specific items it finds.

description.contents: Banners: displayed in the action bar

body.contents: By default, the item's color is used as the color shown in the title. If its name contains custom formatting, this is used instead.

description.contents: An item that has been renamed in an anvil is interpreted as text.
A stack of more than one item is interpreted as a number.

body.contents: If both are true, the number is shown, then the name.

contents.text: Sprites / Item Textures (requires Minecraft 1.21.9 or later)

body.contents: You can rename any of the following items in an anvil with the name of a sprite or item texture - e.g. 'item/emerald' or 'yourresourcepack:item/yourtexture' - to display that texture as part of the message.

description.contents: Item frame: displayed as a subtitle
Glow item frame: displayed in the action bar

body.contents: The detector can be configured to show its title to all players within a specified range, all players who are online, or all detected players.

description.contents: A player is considered to be "detected" if a player head matching their profile is found in the shulker box. (Minecraft 1.21.9 or later: Optionally, in the configuration menu you can choose to display player head textures in the title, subtitle or action bar.)
